name: Express Employment Professionals-Denton, TX
overview:
Express Employment Professionals is a full-service Human Resource consulting firm.

The Express companies include Express Employment Professionals and Express Professional Staffing. Through these entities, Express offers a full range of staffing services, including temporary placement, evaluation hire, flexible staffing and professional search.

The company reflects the personal and business ethics of its founders. Robert Funk says, “For many people who have lost their jobs, often through no fault of their own, we provide great hope. Our mission is to help people find jobs and our client companies find good employees, and to help those clients to make those jobs and those employees even better.”

Overview Industry: Staffing Company Type: Private Business Model: Franchising Locations: Over 600 Headquarters: Oklahoma City, Okla. Founder, Chairman & CEO: Robert A. Funk Founder & Vice Chairman: William H. Stoller Founded: 1983, franchised in 1985 Company sales: Nearly $2 billion in 2007 Jobs: Express put 375,000 people to work in 2007 Certifications: ISO 9001:2000 Ratings: D&B Rating of 5A1

Express Affiliates Express Clydesdales Express Event Center Express Travel Service Express Ranches Express Sports Stoller Vineyards

Memberships American Staffing Association International Franchise Association Canadian Staffing Association Association of Canadian Search, Employment & Staffing Service Association of Personnel Service Organizations of South Africa Recruitment & Consulting Services Association

Services Temporary and flexible staffing Evaluation and direct hire Professional and contract staffing HR services Online payroll processing (U.S. only)

Franchise Information Territories: Prime territories are available in the United States, Canada, South Africa and Australia. Ownership: 50-50 Male-Female Partnership: 21%; Male Majority Owner: 44%; Female Majority Owner: 35% Franchise Fees: Initial fee: $35,000; Start-up capital needed: $130,000-$170,000 (dependent on market size) Industry Outlook Industry Growth: The staffing industry employs 2.9 million people per day and has created 530,000 new jobs in the past two years, according to the American Staffing Association (ASA). Staffing Size: The ASA reports industry-wide revenues of over $82 billion in 2005. Download the Fact Sheet in PDF form.
